item.title: The tarmac/concrete has discintigrated causing the concrete to turn to rocks., 8th October
item.description:
This issue has slowly deteriorated over the last 5 years creating uneven holes in the pavement. The tarmac has cracked and has worn away.

item.title: Windermere Road DA7 6PW dangerous surface, 8th October
item.description:
Windermere Road surface is terrible full of potholes and very badly patched holes, the whole Road is extremely uneven. Surrounding roads have all been completely resurfaced but Windermere is like the forgotten road that has been badly patched up. There is a lot of through traffic and including lorries and heavy vehicles delivering to the Sainsbury's Local then driving down Windermere Rd to run round. The increased traffic and school parking in the road hasnt helped with its deterioration. Please could it be resurfaced like neighbouring roads for our safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Windermere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two small 2-seat black sofas fly-tipped either side of road, 8th October
item.description:
I first noticed these fly-tipped on the morning of Mon 6th October, which means that they were probably dumped on the night of Sun 5th. One sofa has been dumped on the West side of the road by the Dulwich Art Group building. The other sofa has been dumped on the East side of the road by the entrance to Ruskin Park House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Champion Hill, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Res block paving damaged due to f/way repair, 8th October
item.description:
Res says that he has got on his ring doorbell on 1st Sept, workman were repairing the footway outside his house. He said that where they were banging this has damaged the block paving on his d/way....says he has got photos to show this, he is asking to have this repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders using the community flower bed on Ivanhoe Rd to fly tip their waste, 8th October
item.description:
I saw a builder who claimed to work for the council via PiLON in Bracknell (he asked me to photograph his lanyard) dump kitchen units from work at (it appears) flat 32B onto the community bed we care for. They destroyed some of the planting and flowers there. He then moved it off the plot with my help. He claimed to have no where else to put it. I called PiLON and they removed the rubbish, I thought this put an end to it. Tues there was rubbish has since returned to the bed and the post box. PiLON claim this is not them in fact. Other builders may now have followed suit? There are other building works nearby on Malfort and Ivanhoe Rd and no visible skip. I felt I had to intervene on Monday because he was destroying our community planting and hard work.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Malfort Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
